1.title: Plastic Surgery Pioneers - Cambridge Military Hospital

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

1.plot: The series returns as Michael visits the former Cambridge Military Hospital in the garrison town of Aldershot, Hampshire to learn of the far-reaching legacy of the medical innovations that took place there.

2.title: Local Heroes - Manchester Fire Station

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

2.plot: Michael ventures inside the London Road Fire Station which was decommissioned in 1986. He learns how the devastating loss of life suffered by the brigade led to the profession being transformed.

3.title: Countdown to WW3

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

3.plot: A top secret Cold War stronghold and a decommissioned Soviet nuclear submarine reveal just how close we came to nuclear armageddon, and the British military's plans if it should come.

4.title: The Palace of Dreams

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

4.plot: Michael visits the abandoned shell of the New Victoria in Bradford, once one of the most impressive entertainment complexes in Britain with a 3,000 seat cinema, grand ballroom and state-of-the-art technology that even 'washed' the air.

5.title: Brighton - A Seaside Escape

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

5.plot: Michael ends his journey in Sussex at the popular seaside resort of Brighton. He examines the Victorian engineering keeping the ruined West Pier standing. He then joins Britain's oldest swimming club for a dip in the sea.

1.title: Royal London Hospital: Healthcare for All

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

1.plot: Michael visits the Royal London Hospital in the East End which closed its doors in 2013 but pioneered medical breakthroughs and universal health-care for generations from its founding in 1740.

2.title: Orford Ness: Defence of the Realm

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

2.plot: Michael visits one of the most mysterious places in Britain. On the Suffolk coast lie a complex of bunkers, rusting towers and crumpled military hardware once home to an Anglo-American over-the-horizon radar system.

3.title: Shepton Mallet

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

3.plot: Michael explores Shepton Mallet prison which over its 400-year history has seen executions and escape attempts, been used as a store for historical documents during wartime and became the U.S. military's WWII death-row.

4.title: Imber Village: The Wages of War

episode of.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (TV Series 2018)

4.plot: In 1943, the village of Imber on Salisbury Plain began to be used as a Second World War training ground. The residents were ordered to leave by the War Office and, despite promises to the contrary, have never been allowed to return.

imdb.title: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain
akas: Portillo's Hidden History of Britain (United Kingdom)
plot: Former British Secretary of State for Defence 'Michael Portillo' (qv) visits abandoned, iconic locations around the UK that were at the centre of relatively unknown historical events but which are not open to the public.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>
